intro: Episcia maculata, commonly known as the spotted waxy plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that often display distinctive markings. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, which bloom in clusters. Episcia maculata thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It requires well-draining soil and consistent moisture to flourish.
